Reviews.Title: “without any charm and warmth”
Reviews.Author: anjaVoorschoten
Reviews.Content: We were greeted on a sunday by a very unfriendly looking and not very helpful receptionist. Not a good sign for a 4 star hotel. Room was oke with 2 big beds and a nice bathroom. But what is lacking is this hotel is warmth and charm. It doesnt feel like anyone reealy cares who works there. No information at all in your room. Not about Madrid, not about the swimmingpool, the route to the metro etc. Breaffast was just as lifeless. Everything was there, but just white toast bread and no fresh cakes etc. In Spain almost everywhere you have free wifi, but here you had to pay (which I didn't do). Oke people who stay for their work, maybe do not care if it is free or not, but why you still have to pay for wifi in 2012?? No, I will not return to this hotel. we had a great rate, so that made our stay worthwile but if I would have paid the full price, I would have not be very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business traveling”
Reviews.Author: fjuka
Reviews.Content: It's a little bit too far from the city centre (about 30 min from SOL). The hotel is in the walking distance to the metro (10 min) but you are to go uphill and it's not too easy with the luggage. If you travel light it doesn't matter. It easy to get to the airport and to Chamartin train station by metro. Just across the street from the hotel there's a supermarket (doesn't work on Sundays). The surroundings are quiet and green. I stayed in the hotel twice. Both times the rooms looked great and were clean but... had only one set of shower gel, shampoo, soap and one glass for bathroom (the room was double!). Two different glasses in the room (suppose they don't have similar ones...). Only one set of towels (when I asked they gave me the other one). You can see bathing robes on the hotel photos - we didn't have any. Also the presence of kitchenette is mentioned in the description of the hotel but it is only in some rooms (the second time I stayed in such room), it includes microwave, heating panel, sink a fridge, but no houseware (plates, cups, spoons or anything else) so it doesn't make any sense. Another odd thing is the door-window leading outside from the bathroom to some technical compartment outdoors (!), so it was rather cold in the bathroom even if that door was closed. The soundproofing is bad! Sometimes I had an impression that someone is taking a shower in by bathroom :) The staff is not very helpful: when we ask how to get to Toledo the man at the reception gave us wrong directions, so don't count on them. I'm not sure if I'd recommend this hotel: the price is good for Madrid (I paid 60 euro per night for double), but it is far from centre and there's nothing special about the hotel, so your choice depends on your plans.

Reviews.Title: “A business hotel in a nice neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: artseaman
Reviews.Content: This is out of the way, a kilometer to the Metro. A grocery is near by and a good restaurant. Basically a business hotel. Restaurant is expensive by Spanish standards. WiFi is expensive also. The hotel is immaculately clean and quiet. Desk staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: JOSPIR89
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, confortable and spacious. The breakfast is the standard one for this kind of Hotel. The amenities are the shampoo and shower gel, and that's all.I liked the room. I dind't like the service and the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to put your head down after long travels.”
Reviews.Author: SmithyNZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on two separate nights at either end of our travels elsewhere in Spain. The hotel was a bit further away from the Metro than the 500m claimed on the website, but was still only 10 mins walk max. We went to & from the airport on the Metro - pretty straightforward if you do your research first on which lines to use. Reception staff on all occasions were friendly and helpful, and spoke English. The rooms are reasonably spacious, new and clean. I'm over 6ft in height so the beds were too short, but I get that pretty much anywhere we stay. Breakfast was tasty and a good variety. Due to long travels we just used room service for dinner - it was prompt, and quite satisfactory. There's a supermarket just around the corner, as well as a pharmacy and 2 or 3 restaurants / bars. Quiet neighbourhood. Overall a satisfactory experience.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service - very unwelcoming to say the least”
Reviews.Author: Traveller0258
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, lovely quiet location with easy routes into the center of Madrid. On the negative side, where do I start? On arrival, the check in took a long time. The hotel itself is nicely presented in a modern fashion. We ordered a twin room but were actually given a double. We did not complain about this as we thought it would be the only problem. We then discovered the room had only been set for one person, despite the fact our check in details clearly stated there were two of us. There were no details about the hotel in the room and the only thing there was a magazine about various places in Madrid. We could see the swimming pool from our room but had absolutely no idea how to get to it! After working through the maze of the hotel, we found the pool! We asked various members of staff about where to go in Madrid and what the best sites were. In the day time, the reception staff were very rude and did not seem concerned about our inquiry and brushed us off. The night porter was the friendliest member of staff who gave us a map and pointed out good places. On our last night, we decided to check out the cocktail bar upstairs. The doors were open and the lights were on but there was no bar man. What looked like a handy man then rang down to reception who told us the bar was not open and we had to go for a drink downstairs. When we went downstairs, we were seated with no option as to where we would like to sit and given the same cocktail menu as the one we had seen upstairs. For some odd reason, the cocktails were more expensive downstairs and when we asked about this, we were brushed off again. We waited for roughly half an hour for our drinks order to be taken and then a further half an hour for the drinks. We then decided to go outside for a cigarette. There were diners on one side, and the other side was empty and so we decided to go away from the diners, thinking they would not like our smoke whilst they were eating! A waiter came out and told us to move immediately, in a very rude tone, as the tables were reserved for diners, although there were only one table eating (the guys we moved away from!) We went back inside and what we assume was the manager then told us we could go back outside and sit on the table we were on! After one drink, we were sick of being treated badly and left the bar. So, if you want to go to a clean hotel and not socialise with staff - this is the place to go. Otherwise, steer clear!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a pleasant residential area, well connected to the city centre”
Reviews.Author: Ceszij
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel in a safe and pleasant residential neighbourhood of northern Madrid. Despite being quite far from city centre, underground station (Pinar de Chamartin) is just a 6-7 mins walk from the hotel and has 2 different lines, so it is very easy to get everywhere in the city in 15-20 mins. Rooms are spacious & clean, personnel is nice, so you really feel comfortable. Bathroom is spacious too, specially the superb shower. Nearby the hotel there are several bars or restaurants (inside 5 mins walk) if you don't like eating or having breakfast at the hotel. If you don't mind not being in the city centre and want to spend very reasonable prices whilst having good service and conditions, this is your hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good size rooms, well kept, good value, location OK”
Reviews.Author: imurphy
Reviews.Content: Had a one room suite. Good quality bedroom, living area, bathroom. No frills in lobby (mainly business customers) 5 mins walk to Metro & 20 min metro ride to city centre Quiet residential area with a few decent restaurants & smaller "tavernas" nearby Brush up on your Spanish as reception is only place you will be understood.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3* business hotel”
Reviews.Author: schiggorat
Reviews.Content: We never been to Madrid before and we started searching for hotels pretty late. Husa Mirador de Ch. was in fact the cheapest option and we went for it. The location is a bit off the center but linked very well to main tourist attractions via metro. We quite liked that you just take a train from the Pinar de Chamartin (5-10 min walk from the hotel) and get to Sol without changing the train. For a 4stars hotel the rooms are pretty small and "all in black design" is pretty depressing. The bed was superb, very comfortable and the mattress hard and solid. The bathroom was great with designer facilities. And we totally LOVED massive 40" plasma TV set. The staff was alright but we did not have to communicate much with them and we did not have any problems, in fact. We did not go for a breakfast as we were on a tight budget so we went to the supermarket instead which was 100 m from the hotel. In general it's a good hotel for someone on business in Madrid but it is not really for a romantic getaway or a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Not advised...”
Reviews.Author: Melonface
Reviews.Content: I do not suggest you stay here for the following reasons: The staff are unhelpful and slightly rude; there was a mistake when booking the room resulting in us paying for a room that was not big enough for our family of 4 so rather than the receptionist pointing this out when checking in, we had to go to the room, order an extra bed, the housekeeper arrived saying there was not enough room (which was obvious), i was given a phone, spoke to the receptionist who confirmed the room was too small so we were moved after several very slow conversations (on the phone and back at reception) explaining the situation. All the staff I encountered were not very friendly or helpful. The walls of the hotel are too thin; I could hear almost every word of the people next door and the noise from the room above made it impossible to sleep. The photos of the hotel show a garden area, there is no such thing. The pool is surrounded by a small waterlogged grass area with no plants, chairs or loungers (or anything!) only a fence separating it from the hotel and an office building both towering above you on three sides. There is no bar or lounge area just a very expensive restaurant that closes very early. There is nothing in the surrounding area of interest just high rise apartments. The wi-fi is very slow and not free. No double beds just singles pushed together. The floor mat in our room curled at the edges so tripped you up every time you walked over it (not a major point but while I am on a rant..!) A balcony would have been nice. The problem with the room was because the hotel gave the wrong information to hotels .com. Spare yourself an unpleasant stay, don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable and well connected”
Reviews.Author: mandeep834
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the hotel for about 2 months and had a very comfortable and convenient stay. The location of the hotel is very good and well connected to the down town through metro and bus service. The amenities in the hotel were excellent , big spacious rooms, modular kitchen,laundry service, breakfast buffet etc. The staff at hotel was also helpful and knew english :) ...all in all its a very good hotel to stay and spend some quality time in spain !!!

Reviews.Title: “It's nice, but very far from downtown”
Reviews.Author: LunaCampinaGrande
Reviews.Content: It's a very beautiful hotel. It's far from downtown, but has a metro near. The atendents no are simpatics.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Northern Madrid.”
Reviews.Author: StifMaster
Reviews.Content: I have been several times in this hotel, and most of the times it has been a pleasant experience. It's located in the Northern part of the city, close to Chamartin station. It's well connected with the impressive Madrid's motorway (M30 and M40) and metro (closest station at 10 min. on foot) network. Good location if you have something to do in this part of the city or you just want a place to spend the night, but avoid it if you are a tourist looking for the typical Madrid's landmarks. In that case there are lots of better options close to the historical center. I have seen works inside the hotel for a long time. They seem to be refurbishing the rooms, giving them a modern appealing appearance. In some cases they are so modern that they lose functionality, but in general it has been a good idea. Rooms are big, extremely clean and have a small kitchen. Staff is usually friendly and competent, especially one of the guys. Fares used to be a great deal some years ago (when there was no metro connection), but they aren't any longer. Still, they usually are the lowest in the area (around €80-€100), not a bad price since there are no cheap hotels in this area. I had a very bad experience with their fire alarm, with doesn't seems to be well adjusted. It sounded at night while I was sleeping. After calling reception, they told me it happened because a customer had burnt some food in the small kitchen. I thought I just had bad luck but 2 weeks later it happened again at 2AM. Again, reception blamed a customer for wrongly cooking something (at 2AM??). In general, a good hotel if you plan to stay in this part of the city, but not if you are the usual tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Great oportunity”
Reviews.Author: Claudia_Pinus
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel! It's a bit far from the city center, but near a subway station (Pinar de Chamartin). In just 30min you are in a central area (Plaza del Sol). The neighborhood is mostly residential and very quiet. Has a nearby exquisit Italian restaurant with excelent pastas and pizzas. We left our car in the hotel park for 4 days, secured, and visited the city by foot or subway. The access to the hotel is quite iasy, once that it's locaded near the city iner circular. The reception was finishing the remodelation works but the rooms and corredors were finished. The suites have a useful kitchnette. The only but, is that they don't washt your dishes when cleaning the room. Good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here! You're miles away from anything, the aparthotel is surrounded by high-rise residential apartment blocks. Just a couple of restaurants nearby, with no shopping. I stayed here for two reasons: 1) Outdoor pool and 2) Easy to get to IFEMA (conference centre). Neither reasons were justified. The pool doesn't open until mid June, though of course no-one pointed this out when I was booking. I had been told that it was a short walk to Chamartin Metro station, when it was actually 20 minutes hard walking. So I ended up spending a fortune in cabs. I knew of course that the hotel was towards the north of the city, but nothing prepared me for just how far out you are, basically in a residential area. The room itself was actually rather nice, but I wouldn't ever stay there again; the location is awful. Spend your money elsewhere and stay nearer the centre, would be my advice.

HotelInfo.Name: Suites Husa Mirador de Chamartin
HotelInfo.Address: Arte 14 | Pinar de Chamartin, 28033 Madrid, Spain
